result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott W. Andraschko

records.addlTxt:
2:34 PM Defendant Scott W. Andraschko in court.  Attorney Patrick Michael Brady in court for Scott W. Andraschko.  Attorney Alexander Huber in court for State of Wisconsin.  Clerk HM.  DE requests adjmt to get personal issues in order. State takes no position.  PLEAS 2/3 11am.  Bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 3, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Plea hearing on October 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
9/21/22 hearing rescheduled by Court due to ongoing JT.  Attys emailed 9/20/22. NTBS.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining balance on the client service fee.

State appears by Attorney Alexander Huber.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Brady.   Clerk HMcBride. Offer received. PLEAH 9/21 1:30pm.  State will file an Amended Information for OWI 3rd. Bond continued.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining balance on the client service fee.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Mary Cole for Atty Brady.   Clerk HMcBride.  Atty Brady needs time for more investigation.  Adjmt granted.   PTC 8/12 930am.  Bond continued.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining balance on the client service fee.

Defendant, Scott W. Andraschko, appeared with Attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Attorney Emily K. Gaertner appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:   DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 1.  Information filed; reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Branch 1 Scheduling Order completed and given to Attorney.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
WCS Supervision Status Report.  In order to satisfy all the program requirements, the defendant must complete primary treatment and pay the remaining $350 balance on the client service fee.
Request for Hearing on the Revocation - filed by Atty Patrick Brady
